content.match_overview: Liverpool host Southampton in a Premier League clash pitting the league leaders against the bottom-placed side. The Reds are 13 points clear at the summit with a 20-1-7 record, while Southampton sit 20th with just 9 points from 27 matches. Liverpool's last five matches show four wins and one draw (WWWDW), demonstrating their ability to grind results even when not at peak performance. Southampton's LLDWD form highlights their defensive vulnerabilities, having conceded a league-worst 65 goals. Historical data shows Liverpool's dominance with 64 wins in 121 meetings, including 17 victories in their last 27 Premier League encounters[1][4].

team_news.raw: Liverpool face uncertainty over Cody Gakpo's availability after a training ground knock, though Diogo Jota remains ready to deputize. Long-term absentees Joe Gomez (ankle), Conor Bradley (muscle), and Tyler Morton (knee) remain sidelined. Southampton's injury crisis worsens with six first-team players out including Bednarek (hamstring) and Adam Lallana (calf), severely limiting their defensive options. Managerless Southampton are expected to field a makeshift back three against the league's most potent attack[1][2][7].
